rComments: This prof is honestly such a gem and cares a lot about his students. The course is structured so well. He can be a little dry at times but overall super good class

such a good fella, i had such a good time in his class. he makes you read a fair bit but makes it rewarding. his lectures can sometimes lack structure but that may just be because of COVID online transition. would def recommend this prof, plus he's super understanding!!!

Absolutely love Arel, a slow marker but he's not too tough and gives good feedback. There is a good amount of work but it's spread out and formatted well. The best part about Arel is how much he really cares about the material and his students. He always remembers people and answers emails almost immediately. Definitely one of uOttwa's best
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Accessible outside class', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: lots of assigned readings but only bother with them if you don't understand something or need them for an assignment. just pay attention during the lectures and take lots of notes, and you'll be fine. his classes can be a lot of work but they're worth it. absolutely love Arel, definitely my favourite prof at uOttawa.
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures ', 'Clear grading criteria', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Professor Arel is fantastic. Yes, there's tons to read. Yes, there's lots of assignments. But if you take an interest in the topic he's teaching, his class is an extremely rewarding experience. Also: he's hilarious!

Professor Arel is really passionate about the material he teaches. Though his PowerPoints are a little dry, and he does not usually give back grades in a timely manner. Try and join the conversation, he definitely favors students that engage in class discussion. Participation is a huge but easy part of the grade.

One of the best Profs Have had at U Ottawa. Have taken his courses twice and they are really interesting. You can tell how much he cares about the students and his work. The course load was pretty heavy, it was online b/c Covid, but you will learn a lot.

Professor Arel is incredibly caring about the topics in class, and about his students. Although there is a huge amount of readings, his lectures are easy to follow, and he is extremely educated on the topics which he teaches. Be ready for examsto be largely readings based! He may seem like a tough marker but if you do the readings you'll do well.

Arel is a great prof, but you need to go to his lectures if you want to do well. The midterm seems as if it would be hard having to write 4 responses in the 80min class but I knew 3 of the questions going into the midterm only because I went to the class before the midterm. Show Arel you care about the course and he will help you no matter what.

Arel is the type of prof where you learn to love him. Honestly I didn't quite fancy his teaching style for the first couple of weeks; however, it turned out to be one of my fav classes. he doesn't post slides so attendance is mandatory, but you can get away with minimal reading. I would recommend him as a prof for sure! and he's a giant sweetheart!

Great Prof. Lots of readings but they connect well with the lectures so you pretty much have to do it. Not typical lectures, but is very indepth. Leaves you with a good understanding of topic. I recommend bringing a laptop for notes. Type out the slide then he'll talk for a few mins about it, referencing the readings and such.

He's not very clear on grading criteria, at all. TAs were all quite rude (unsure if this was coincidental), and it's hard to get any sort of helpful feedback. The midterm is ridiculous, you have to write 4 papers and it's nearly impossible to finish. You'd think they would be more understanding and accommodating during a pandemic, but no. 2/10

Lectures are not organized and do not follow any coherent thought. Mid term exam was 4 essays in 80 minutes, and expectations for research paper, midterms, presentations and exam are completely irrational per the given time constraints. Good luck doing well in this class.

Notorious for assigning a lot of readings, but its really not necessary to do all of them. I just re-read the ones that were mentioned in class a lot. No phone policy in class and will call you out on it. Generally kind of an odd guy, but extremely knowledgeable. I loved his lectures. If you're not lazy and you pay attention you'll be fine.

He is a very nice person and also a good teacher. He encourages participation and will help you develop your ability to argue by challenging you (always in a respectful and thoughtful manner). It is true that the amount of work required in this course is slightly higher than the typical poli sci one, but you'll take away things from this course.

warning: in the last lecture the surprise he refers to is a surprise debate on the films studied in class. You will be randomly selected to go to the front of the class and share your impressions on the film.
He provided us two assignments due on the same day even though earlier in the semester he said he wouldn't even do the first assignment.
can't hear anything in class. doesnt use mic.

Terrible prof. Doesn't even use his mic during class so for the people that sit in the back, i honestly don't know how they do it? His lectures are long, rambles a lot, and does not make a correlation between the readings and his lecture really. readings are so lengthy, its overwhelming. oh & no laptops allowed. 11/10 would NOT recommend. r u n !
TAs are super hard markers, so if you want your average hurt sign up. Prof is boring and very elitist
Worse teacher ever
His amount of readings are ridiculous for his course. Almost 60 pages every week!
Very boring content, very boring voice. Can't even hear him in class. I want to drop his course so bad.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lecture heavy', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: Horrible professor. Just horrible.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: He seems knowledgeable and like an interesting person to talk to. Lectures are extremely dry and hard to sit through if you have him at 8:30 like me, but the amount of reading he required for this class is absurd for a second year class - often more than 50 or 60 pages per lecture!

i cannot believe he's refusing to change a 10am midterm AFTER KNOWING THE UNI CANCELLED CLASSES FOR A WHOLE STORM THE DAY BEFORE so now i have to bus a whole hour in horrible road conditions for a prof who doesn't use a mic, rambles about ONE slide for 20 mins and literally rants about BASIC concepts!
Absolutely boring. Doesn't use a mic so we cannot hear him. His slides are useless and the readings are way too heavy for the course.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Its been two weeks and I want more than anything to drop this class. This prof is seemingly unmotivated and uninterested in this class and he is horrifically unsatisfactory in every way possible. Nice enough dude but should never be teaching.

I had to write a review because I was led-astray by past reviews. Personally, I would not take one of his classes again. I found his teaching style very boring. Powerpoint are hardly helpful, but even so you must go to every class because he doesn't post anything online. Very reading-based & the readings are ridiculously long. No tech. allowed.
Arel is nice enough. His slides are completely useless, so you basically just have to write down what he is saying.  There are crazy amounts of readings for this class. Watch out, be prepared.

I loved this prof, he differently knows his stuff. I understood so many new concepts in his class. I definitely recommend taking his class. The workload is very heavy, so get ready to work for good grades. He does not post notes online so you have to attend the lectures. All in all, if you do your work and go to class you will love him as a prof.

There is a ridiculous amount of reading for this class. You should definitely start your readings as early as September instead of a week or two before the exam. Marking is soso you definitely need to know your stuff that means the slide and the readings very well. Marking is fair, the slides are confusing and random.

Very knowledgeable prof, really knows his stuff; however, workload was HEAVY. 4ish rather long readings per week, and an assignment due every other week. Interesting class, would recommend it - but expect A LOT of work.

Exceptionally knowledgeable in his field, decent professor. About 8 assignments given so there's a bit too heavy a workload (to the point that it affected quality of my work for other courses). Often critical of students' input in discussions. Too many readings; he doesn't (and can't possibly) cover all of a week readings in the three weekly hours.

Does not allow electronics in class, which makes it quite a hassle to take notes. Has a decently thick french accent but most of the time it isn't a large problem. Classes were extremely boring, and sometimes it was difficult to ascertain what he wanted with regards to assignments.  His lack of enthusiasm makes the class tiring at best.

Absolutely loved this class. At first I was taken aback by his "no electronics" rule, but it really did help the class focus. his lectures were very interesting and entertaining. He is very knowledgeable, especially on Ukraine! Definitely recommend his class.
He's extremely organized!
good prof and a good guy in general. class was boring as sin though but he makes some good jokes once in a while to liven it up

Really nice guy, and very helpful. His classes can be very boring, and a lot of the readinss are long and boring. However, all readings are available online, and all assignments are emailed, so other than registration, the class is completely free! He is a very relaxed guy, and very knowledgeable in the field.

Initially, will come off as a bit egoistic, but that is in part due to a language barrier that most don't notice.  Very challenging, very intelligent, very passionate, and VERY HELPFUL.  Looks forward to working with & getting to know students.  Doesn't hold grudges (learned through experience).
Great class
Very choppy lectures.  Knows his stuff.  Doesn't listen well in class when students try to make a point.  Assigns tedious work.
Very helpful and always accessible
doesn't give enough time to write exams, you have to sign into class, if your not there, he e-mails you and asks for harasses you.

He's ok teacher but doesn't have a particular stan on things. Lack of preparation for the cours makes it very unclear. Alot of participation in class its good but again its due to his lack of analysis.
A great class with a fantastic prof!
No Comments
